       Geselecteerde taal: EN
         1. Internship | Full stack / frontend developer
       Type dienstverband: Internship and graduation project Locatie: Den Haag Opleidingsniveau: Bachelor Uren per week: Fulltime - 40
       Internship | Full stack / frontend developer
       About this position
       In the near future, the Dutch manufacturing industry needs to improve on efficiency, flexibility and collaboration. Industry 4.0 (i4.0) addresses these challenges by leveraging IT solutions and connectivity to access, process and use data that is being generated in manufacturing. To speed-up our research in i4.0 we have built a configurable production line simulator. This simulator generates realistic data for experimentation with international standards and new technology (e.g. generative AI). To build these experiments we need to configure several simulation artifacts, define test scenarios and provide a low-code environment for integrating 3rd party software.
       What will be your role?
       This assignment is about building a user-friendly and attractive user interface for the existing simulator.
       An indication of tasks for the assignment:
          + Learn about Industry 4.0 and the manufacturing domain
          + Investigate & evaluate concepts and solutions for defining experiments and low-code integration of 3rd party software
          + Design and implement the chosen solution in the user-interface
          + Design and implement extensions for the backend, e.g. REST and websocket interfaces
          + Write unit and integration tests
          + Evaluate user experience (UX)
          + To elicit the right design requirements and validate your work, you will work with data scientists and a production engineer from one of our clients on building a simulation of a real production line. If any simulation capabilities are missing, either you or another team member will implement those.
       The current technology stack consists of:
          + Frontend: Svelte + Typescript
          + Backend: Python (FastAPI)
          + CI/CD: Docker, Gitlab CI, unit tests
       You will join our team of experienced developers, working closely to collaborate and share expertise.
       The assignment will mainly take place at TNO, but we will visit some of our partner manufacturing sites for introduction, experimentation and validation.
       What we expect from you
          + You are a HBO student ICT, Informatica or related and looking for a graduation assignment of 6-9 months.
          + You have an interest in the challenges that come with discrete simulation and software development, especially frontend / user-interface development.
          + You have a do-er mindset and like working in a multi-disciplinary environment.
       What you'll get in return
       You want an internship opportunity on the precursor of your career; an internship gives you an opportunity to take a good look at your prospective future employer. TNO goes a step further. It's not just looking that interests us; you and your knowledge are essential to our innovation. That's why we attach a great deal of value to your personal and professional development. You will, of course, be properly supervised during your work placement and be given the scope for you to get the best out of yourself. Furthermore, we provide:
          + A highly professional, innovative internship environment, within a team of top experts.
          + A suitable internship allowance (615 euro for wo-, hbo- and mbo-students, for a full-time internship).
          + Possibility of eight hours of free leave per internship month (for a full-time internship).
          + A free membership of Jong TNO , where you can meet other TNO professionals and join several activities , such as sports activities, (work-related) courses or the yearly ski-trip.
          + Use of a laptop.
          + An allowance for travel expenses in case you don't receive an OV-card.
       TNO as an employer
       At TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you: who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters: impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow's world. Read more about TNO as an employer .
       At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion .
       The selection process
       After the first CV selection, the application process will be conducted by the concerning department. TNO will provide a suitable internship agreement. If you have any questions about this vacancy, you can contact the contact person mentioned below.
       Important to be aware of before applying:
          +
               o 2) the internship takes place as part of the programme of the study.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on frontend and full-stack development within the context of Industry 4.0 and manufacturing simulation. While it mentions 'generative AI' as a technology for experimentation, the core tasks and required skills are centered around UI/UX design, backend development (REST, websockets), and traditional software engineering practices, rather than the development or fine-tuning of AI models themselves.

phrases: Learn about Industry 4.0 and the manufacturing domain
In the near future, the Dutch manufacturing industry needs to improve on efficiency, flexibility and collaboration.
Industry 4.0 (i4.0) addresses these challenges by leveraging IT solutions and connectivity to access, process and use data that is being generated in manufacturing.
job_tasks.justification: These phrases indicate a need to understand the business context of manufacturing, Industry 4.0 challenges, and how IT solutions address them.

phrases: building a user-friendly and attractive user interface for the existing simulator
Design and implement the chosen solution in the user-interface
Design and implement extensions for the backend, e.g. REST and websocket interfaces
The current technology stack consists of: Frontend: Svelte + Typescript, Backend: Python (FastAPI)
job_tasks.justification: The core of the role involves building user interfaces and backend extensions, including API development (REST, websockets), which are fundamental software development tasks.

phrases: CI/CD: Docker, Gitlab CI, unit tests
job_tasks.justification: Mention of CI/CD tools like Docker and Gitlab CI, along with writing unit and integration tests, points to operational aspects of software deployment and quality assurance.

While 'generative AI' is mentioned as a technology for experimentation, the job description does not detail tasks related to building, training, or fine-tuning generative models. The focus is on integrating with or experimenting using these technologies, not developing them.

phrases: you will work with data scientists and a production engineer from one of our clients
You will join our team of experienced developers, working closely to collaborate and share expertise.
Learn about Industry 4.0 and the manufacturing domain
Investigate & evaluate concepts and solutions for defining experiments and low-code integration of 3rd party software
If any simulation capabilities are missing, either you or another team member will implement those.
take the lead on defining and implementing new features
